path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/Coinfabrik/EasyPool Smart Contract Security Audit v2 - CoinFabrik Blog.pdf

findings.title: Misuse of the different call methods: _call.value()_ , _send()_ and _transfer()_
findings.description: No incorrect use of _call()_ or _send()_ , and _transfer()_ was found. Calls to these methods were done on checked input, with correct coverage of requirements.

findings.title: Inconsistent Usage of SafeMath Functions
findings.description: The inconsistent usage of SafeMath functions can lead to errors and possible future changes could cause bugs, especially with regards to integer rounding errors, overflow, and underflow.

findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability in _addressCall_ function
findings.description: The only call to an external contract is in the _addressCall_ function, but considering it’s private and is only called from _payToPresale_, which calls to this function with the _presaleAddress_ that’s set.

findings.title: Unprotected setters for addresses that could cause transfers to unwanted addresses
findings.description: There are many setters for addresses that could if not enough checks are done on input, cause transfers to unwanted addresses. However, these functions have the correct modifiers so only the administrator of the pool can change these.

findings.title: Misuse of block timestamps, assuming things other than them being strictly increasing
findings.description: Assuming block timestamps to be strictly increasing, which is not always the case.

findings.title: Contract softlocking attacks (DoS) / unbounded gas usage
findings.description: No function in the contract has a loop that can be abused to cause a soft lock or an unbounded usage of gas.
